Description: Wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of possibly Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior, from top: wide black (fired reddish) band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of back of deer or bull, to left; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same krater as British Museum 1886, 0401.672 and 1924, 1201.1306. C. W. Neeft (personal communication) considers that the vessel may not be Corinthian, as there are questions about the origin of the fabric.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 234)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 671, no. 299)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.011) (Phase 1)
